verses.verse: Lamentation for Egypt The word of the LORD came to me:
(Isa 13.6; Ezek 21.12; Joel 1.5, 11, 13) Mortal, prophesy, and say: Thus says the Lord GOD: Wail, “Alas for the day!”
(v 18|EZK 30:18; Ezek 7.7, 12; Joel 2.1; Ob 15; Zeph 1.7) For a day is near, the day of the LORD is near; it will be a day of clouds, a time of doom (Heb lacks of doom) for the nations.
(vv 5, 9, 11|EZK 30:5911; Ezek 29.19) A sword shall come upon Egypt, and anguish shall be in Cush, when the slain fall in Egypt, and its wealth is carried away, and its foundations are torn down.

(Jer 25.20, 24) Cush and Put and Lud and all the mixed populations and Libya (Compare Gk Syr Vg: Heb Cub) and the people of the allied land (Meaning of Heb uncertain) shall fall with them by the sword.
(Isa 20.3-6; Ezek 29.10) Thus says the LORD: Those who support Egypt shall fall, and its proud might shall come down; from Migdol to Syene they shall fall within it by the sword, says the Lord GOD.
(Ezek 29.12) They shall be desolated among other desolated countries, and their cities shall lie among cities laid waste.
(vv 5, 6, 14, 16|EZK 30:561416; Ezek 29.6, 9, 16) Then they shall know that I am the LORD, when I have set fire to Egypt, and all who help it are broken.

(Isa 18.1, 2; Ezek 32.9, 10; 38.11) On that day, messengers shall go out from me in ships to terrify the secure Cushites, and anguish shall come upon them on the day of Egypt’s doom, (Heb the day of Egypt) for it is coming!
(Ezek 29.19) Thus says the Lord GOD: I will put an end to the hordes of Egypt, by the hand of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon.

(v 4|EZK 30:4; Ezek 28.7) He and his people with him, the most terrible of the nations, shall be brought in to destroy the land, and they shall draw their swords against Egypt and fill the land with the slain.

(Isa 19.5, 6; Ezek 29.3, 9) I will dry up the channels of the Nile and will sell the land into the hand of evildoers; I will bring desolation upon the land and everything in it by the hand of foreigners; I the LORD have spoken.

(v 16|EZK 30:16; Isa 19.1, 16; Zech 10.11; 13.2) Thus says the Lord GOD: I will destroy the idols and put an end to the images in Memphis; there shall no longer be a prince in the land of Egypt, so I will put fear in the land of Egypt.
(vv 15, 16|EZK 30:1516; Ps 78.12, 43; Ezek 29.14) I will make Pathros a desolation and will set fire to Zoan and will execute acts of judgment on Thebes.
(v 16|EZK 30:16; Jer 46.25) I will pour my wrath upon Pelusium, the stronghold of Egypt, and will cut off the hordes of Thebes.
I will set fire to Egypt; Pelusium shall be in great agony; Thebes shall be breached and Memphis face adversaries by day.
The young men of On and of Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword, and the cities themselves (Heb and they) shall go into captivity.

(v 3|EZK 30:3; Jer 43.8-13; Ezek 34.27) At Tehaphnehes the day shall be dark, when I break there the dominion of Egypt, and its proud might shall come to an end; the city (Heb she) shall be covered by a cloud, and its daughter towns shall go into captivity.
(vv 14, 25, 26) Thus I will execute acts of judgment on Egypt. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.
Proclamation against Pharaoh In the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:
(Ps 10.15; Jer 46.11) Mortal, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; it has not been bound up for healing or wrapped with a bandage, so that it may become strong to wield the sword.

(Ps 37.17; Ezek 29.3) Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt and will break his arms, both the strong arm and the one that was broken, and I will make the sword fall from his hand.
(v 26|EZK 30:26; Ezek 29.12) I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the lands.

(vv 10, 25|EZK 30:1025; Ezek 21.14, 25; 26.15; Zeph 2.12; Zech 10.12) I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put my sword in his hand, but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before him with the groans of one mortally wounded.

(vv 11, 22, 24|EZK 30:112224; Isa 5.25) I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fall. And they shall know that I am the LORD when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon. He shall stretch it out against the land of Egypt,
(Ezek 29.12) and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.
